p: The chemical composition of summer savory was revealed in several studies performed on S. hortensis volatile oils and, in fewer cases, extracts. Considering the general composition, the fresh leaves contain moisture (72%), protein (4.2%), fat (1.65%), sugar (4.45%), fibre (8.60%) and ash (2.11%) [ 2]. Discussing the composition on a dry weight basis, the main source for bioactive compounds is the volatile oil (up to 5%), triterpenic acids, tannins (up to 8%), mucilage, resins, sugars, mineral salts, etc. [ 1].
